headline.main: The Most Popular Health Topics of 2011

docs.abstract: High protein diets and superhero workouts - those were two of the most sought after topics on the Internet in 2011.

docs.lead_paragraph: Preterm boys in a study had more sleep and attention troubles than their full-term peers, and preterm girls were significantly more emotionally reactive, depressed and withdrawn.

headline.seo: Greater Behavioral Risks for Preemies at Preschool Age
headline.main: Risks: More Woes for Preemies at Preschool Age
headline.print_headline: Risks: More Woes for Preemies at Preschool Age

docs.abstract: Study published in The Archives of Disease in Childhood finds that babies born only three weeks prematurely face an increased risk of behavioral and emotional problems as preschoolers; epidemiologist Sijmen A Reijneveld of the University of Groningen is study's lead author.
docs.snippet: Preterm boys in a study had more sleep and attention troubles than their full-term peers, and preterm girls were significantly more emotionally reactive, depressed and withdrawn.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 20 studies, including a large analysis of data on more than 200,000 children, have produced results that link acetaminophen use to an increased risk of asthma.

headline.seo: Evidence Mounts Linking Acetaminophen and Asthma

docs.abstract: More than 20 studies have established credible link between sharp worldwide increase in asthma over the past 30 years and widespread adoption of acetaminophen to replace aspirin use in children; some pediatricians have begun recommending that children with asthma not use acetaminophen.
docs.snippet: More than 20 studies, including a large analysis of data on more than 200,000 children, have produced results that link acetaminophen use to an increased risk of asthma.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE HYPOTHESIS Acetaminophen increases the risk of childhood asthma.
docs.abstract: More than 20 studies have established credible link between sharp worldwide increase in asthma over the past 30 years and widespread adoption of acetaminophen to replace aspirin use in children; some pediatricians have begun recommending that children with asthma not use acetaminophen. (M)
docs.snippet: THE HYPOTHESIS     Acetaminophen increases the risk of childhood asthma.

docs.lead_paragraph: The strange second life of a Michigan factory town that lost its factories.

headline.main: Now That the Factories Are Closed, It’s Tee Time in Benton Harbor, Mich.

docs.abstract: Construction of Harbor Shores, a luxury golf resort, and the 270,000-square-foot corporate campus for Whirlpool in the economically distressed town of Benton Harbor, Mich, offers a window into one possible future for towns that can no longer support their own economies and may ultimately have no choice but to turn their fate over to private industry and nonprofits.
docs.snippet: The strange second life of a Michigan factory town that lost its factories.

docs.lead_paragraph: Older Americans have always had a hand in rearing grandchildren. But more and more, their roles have expanded beyond dispensing advice and the occasional treat, because Grandma and Grandpa's house is home. In 2010, seven million grandparents in the United States were living with grandchildren under the age of 18, according to census data. About 2.7 million of those grandparents were the primary caregivers of one or more grandchildren. Of the primary guardians, 63 percent were female.
docs.snippet: Older Americans have always had a hand in rearing grandchildren. But more and more, their roles have expanded beyond dispensing advice and the occasional treat, because Grandma and Grandpa's house is home.     In 2010, seven million grandparents in...

docs.lead_paragraph: It is fair to question Judge Evelyn Laporte’s handling of a defendant who was later arrested in a police officer’s death, but it is unfair to portray her as indifferent to public safety.

headline.seo: As Mayor Lays Blame on Judge, a Court’s Chaotic Context Is Lost
headline.main: As Mayor Lays Blame on Judge, a Court’s Chaotic Context Is Lost
headline.print_headline: As the Mayor Lays Blame on a Judge, a Court’s Chaotic Context Is Lost

docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on the implication from New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg that Judge Evelyn Laporte may be partly to blame for the death of officer Peter J Figoski, shot and killed by Lamont Pride while responding to a robbery in Brooklyn; says that although Laporte had released Pride without bail in November, Bloomberg's portrayal of Laporte as indifferent to public safety does not take into account the chaotic nature of criminal court.
docs.snippet: It is fair to question Judge Evelyn Laporte’s handling of a defendant who was later arrested in a police officer’s death, but it is unfair to portray her as indifferent to public safety.
